author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
I think the name NNetSauce may be more appropriate. It aligns with the python package `nnetsauce` about as well as the current name `Nnetsauce` while following Julia's capitalization conventions.

> LilithHafner

Hi @LilithHafner. Yes, I capitalized the first letter for that reason. I can do `NNetSauce`, I guess it'd be  100% CamelCase that way. 

Right now, I'm struggling a little bit (maybe because i'm relatively new to it) with naming functions'  arguments. Trying to achieve this [https://thierrymoudiki.github.io/blog/2023/11/27/python/r/julia/quasirandomizednn/julia-nnetsauce#](https://thierrymoudiki.github.io/blog/2023/11/27/python/r/julia/quasirandomizednn/julia-nnetsauce#), but I'm getting errors such as 'named parameter `n_hidden_features` not found'. Any suggestion is welcome. Thanks.

Sorry, a solution to that doesn't jump to mind right away. You could try asking about that with a bit more context on [Discourse](https://discourse.julialang.org/) or [Zulip](https://julialang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/274208-helpdesk-.28published.29)

@LilithHafner Ha ha. There IS context. Already told you everything with the link I've added. I'll try Discord or Zulip. 
Will this be automatically merged, though? I guess it's better, in order to avoid going through the _3-days waiting_ twice.

This pull request has been inactive for 30 days and will be automatically closed 7 days from now. If this pull request should not be closed, please either (1) fix the AutoMerge issues and re-trigger Registrator, which will automatically update the pull request, or (2) post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. [noblock]
This pull request has been inactive for more than 30 days and has automatically been closed. Feel free to register your package or version again once you fix the AutoMerge issues. [noblock]

body:

title: New package: Nnetsauce v0.1.0
